intro: Laserpitium prutenicum proles dufourianum, commonly known as the Dufour's mountain grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact clusters, typical of the daisy family. It is native to alpine regions of Central Europe and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
